senses.ex: She gave an outstanding performance in the school play.

Tips.title: Exceptional Praise
Tips.description: Use 'outstanding' when you want to praise something as better than average; it shows high appreciation.

Tips.title: High Recognition
Tips.description: 'Outstanding' often describes something recognized by others as excellent, not just personal opinion.
Tips.example: He received an award for his outstanding work.

Tips.title: Not Ordinary
Tips.description: The word implies something is far from ordinary; it stands out significantly among others.
Tips.example: The scientist made an outstanding discovery.

senses.de: Not yet paid, resolved, or dealt with
senses.ex: I still have some outstanding bills to pay.

Tips.title: Requires Attention
Tips.description: In contexts of tasks or duties, 'outstanding' suggests urgency or importance to resolve or address it.
Tips.example: We discussed the outstanding issues before the deadline.

Tips.title: Pending Status
Tips.description: Indicates something is pending and highlights the need for completion or action.
Tips.example: You have outstanding paperwork to submit.

Tips.title: Financial Obligations
Tips.description: Often relates to money, suggesting that a payment or settlement is still to be made.

senses.ex: His outstanding feature is his sharp nose.

Tips.title: Easily Noticed
Tips.description: 'Outstanding' means it captures attention easily due to being very noticeable or different.

Tips.title: Memorable Quality
Tips.description: Describes a feature or trait that is memorable and leaves a strong impression on others.
Tips.example: Her voice is her most outstanding quality.

Excellent.wordDefinition:
Excellent and outstanding are both words used to describe something as exceptional or beyond average.

However, outstanding is usually reserved for something that is even better than excellent. For example, if you get an A+ on a test, you might be described as having done an excellent job.

Exceptional.wordDefinition:
Exceptional means something that is above average or remarkable, while outstanding means something that is excellent or distinguished.

For example, you could say that someone's academic performance was exceptional if they got straight A's on all their exams.

Both words can describe something that is very good, but each one is more suited to different contexts. Exceptional is typically used to describe something that is better than usual, while outstanding describes something that stands out from the rest of the crowd.

Extraordinary.wordDefinition:
Extraordinary means something that is beyond what is usual or ordinary, while outstanding implies excellence or exceptional quality.

For example, if someone did something that is beyond the scope of ordinary experience, then it can be considered extraordinary.

Extraordinary describes something that is unique or exceptional, while outstanding describes something that is excellent or superior.

Magnificent.wordDefinition:
Both words, magnificent and outstanding, mean something that is very impressive or excellent.

However, magnificent is used more to describe something grand, beautiful, or majestic, like a palace or a sunset. While outstanding is used more to describe something remarkable, excellent in quality or performance, like a student's grades or an athlete's performance in a game.

You can use magnificent when you want to talk about something grand and beautiful, and outstanding when you want to describe something excellent in quality and performance.

Remarkable.wordDefinition:
Remarkable means worthy of attention or being unusual or extraordinary.

For example, if someone has a rare talent or a unique skill, that person can be described as remarkable.

In summary, while both words indicate something extraordinary, outstanding emphasizes quality or achievement, while remarkable emphasizes uniqueness or noteworthiness.

Splendid.wordDefinition:
Splendid on the other hand, is often used to describe something that is visually impressive or beautiful.

We might describe a sunset, a view, or an outfit as splendid.

Outstanding is more commonly used to describe achievements or performance, while splendid describes appearance or visual aspects.

Superb.wordDefinition:
Both outstanding and superb are adjectives that denote high quality and excellence.

Superb means extremely good in a way that surpasses expectations.

It is generally used to describe something that is flawless or perfect. For example: "The service at the restaurant was superb, the food was cooked to perfection.".

Outstanding is used to highlight something as exceptional, while superb emphasizes something as being of the highest quality.

Superior.wordDefinition:
Superior refers to something that is better than something else or of higher quality.

It can also mean being in a higher rank or position. For example, a superior product or a superior officer.

Both words are used to describe excellence, but outstanding is more focused on uniqueness and distinction while superior is more focused on being better in terms of quality or rank.

Outstanding describes something exceptional and impressive, while superior describes something of higher quality or better in comparison to others.

quotes.Text: I didn't get a ton of interest from colleges in baseball and football, but I was outstanding in track and had the sense that this would be my meal ticket... Track was a sport where I saw immediate improvement, and I had a lot of good support behind me... and the coaches had a lot of experience and pushed me in that direction for sure.
quotes.Title: American Athlete
quotes.Name: Dan O'Brien

quotes.Text: I think I've got an outstanding defensive assistant staff that's really going to help us have consistent, strong defenses. And offensively, we have an excellent staff. We've got some younger guys on offense, but that's what I coach and have my entire coaching career.
quotes.Title: American Coach
quotes.Name: Steve Spurrier

quotes.Text: Even though I disagree with many of the changes, when I see the privates graduate at the end of the day, when they walk off that drill field at the end of the ceremony, they are still fine privates; outstanding, well motivated privates.
quotes.Title: American Soldier
quotes.Name: R. Lee Ermey

quotes.Text: I think I could have become an outstanding professional baseball player, but I don't think I could have reached the heights that I have in football - being one of the very top players in the game, being a world champion.
quotes.Title: American Athlete
quotes.Name: Joe Namath

quotes.Text: I was not an outstanding student. I did a reasonable amount of work. I got generally good - pretty good grades, but I was not that passionate about getting straight A's.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Steve Case

quotes.Text: You should allow professors to become really outstanding academicians, recognised worldwide, and you should reward them.
quotes.Title: Malaysian Politician
quotes.Name: Najib Razak

quotes.Text: I'm not an outstanding personality, and I'm certainly no beauty. Acting ability is all I've got to trade on.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Betty Field

quotes.Text: What you see is that the most outstanding feature of life's history is a constant domination by bacteria.
quotes.Title: American Scientist
quotes.Name: Stephen Jay Gould

quotes.Text: We have outstanding schools, world-class teaching and inspirational leadership across the country.
quotes.Title: British Politician
quotes.Name: Nicky Morgan

quotes.Text: The origin of life is one of the great outstanding mysteries of science.
quotes.Title: British Writer
quotes.Name: Paul Davies
